CSSTransformComponent.summary: The CSSTransformComponent interface of the CSS Typed Object Model API is part of the interface.

CSSTransformComponentIs2D.summary: The is2D read-only property of the interface indicates where the transform is 2D or 3D.
CSSTransformComponentIs2D.value:
A boolean. True indicating the transform is a 2D transform, false if it is a 3D
transform.

CSSTransformComponentToMatrix.summary:
The toMatrix() method of the
interface returns a
object.

remarks.para: All transform functions can be represented mathematically as a 4x4 transformation matrix.

blockquote.para: The is2D property affects what transform, and therefore type of matrix that will be returned. CSS 2D and 3D transforms are different for legacy reasons. A brief explanation of 2D vs. 3D transforms can be found in Using CSS transforms.

CSSTransformComponentToString.summary: The toString() method of the interface is a {{Glossary("stringifier")}} returning a CSS Transforms function.
CSSTransformComponentToString.returns: A string in the form of a CSS transform function.This will use the value of is2D to return either a 2D or 3D transform. For example if the component represents and is2D is false then the string returned will be in the form of the CSS transformation transform-function/rotate3d function. If true the string returned will be in the form of the 2-dimensional transform-function/rotate function.
